title: 'Was harassed, tortured': Bengaluru techie dies by suicide; note cites extortion bid
description: A Bengaluru techie died by suicide, accusing a couple and Greater Bengaluru Authority (GBA) officials of abetting his extreme act through harassment and extortion. The deceased's mother filed a complaint against Shashi and Usha Nambiar for demanding Rs 20 lakh and allegedly encouraging officials to harass her son. The couple has been remanded in judicial custody.

description: Dhanush and Kriti Sanon's 'Tere Ishk Mein' experienced a mid-week dip, earning Rs 6.75 crore on Wednesday. Despite this, the film maintains strong domestic hold, especially in metros, and has crossed Rs 100 crore worldwide. This marks Dhanush's biggest Bollywood hit and his first Rs 100 crore global grosser.

Malaria parasites corkscrew their way deeper through skin
description: Malaria sporozoites injected into human skin have to cover hundreds of micrometres to find a capillary that leads them to the liver. Older geometric models had already hinted that the natural distance across which a parasite makes a turn roughly matches the radius of small blood vessels, making it easier to loop around them

title: As Mamata govt welcomes order, BJP says it has given rise to fresh questions
IndiGo havoc: 200 flights cancelled, up to 10-hour delay; DGCA calls top brass
description: IndiGo is experiencing significant flight turmoil, impacting hundreds of thousands of travelers due to over 200 cancelled flights and delays reaching up to 10 hours. The airline attributes these challenges to a shortage of pilots and new operational rules. As travel peaks, aviation regulators have called upon IndiGo's leadership to address the chaos and outline a recovery strategy.

title: Centre agrees to bring back Sunali, son from Bangladesh
description: In a humanitarian move, the Indian government will bring back a pregnant Bangladeshi national, Sunali Khatun, and her son after their deportation. The Supreme Court, emphasizing humanity over law, directed the Centre to send Sunali to her father in West Bengal for care. The court also raised questions about her citizenship based on her father's status.

Guns to games: Surrendered Naxals back on the field, this time for Bastar Olympics
description: Former Maoists are finding new purpose in Chhattisgarh's Bastar Olympics, trading guns for sports.  Surrendered cadres like Kamla and Podiyam Bhima are now training for events like tug-of-war and archery, drawn by the opportunity to rebuild their lives.  This initiative, supported by national leaders, marks a significant shift in the region.

description: A fierce gun battle on the Dantewada-Bijapur border in Chhattisgarh's Bastar region resulted in the deaths of at least 12 Maoists and three District Reserve Guard personnel. This significant loss for the outlawed group occurred as security forces intensified operations in the region. Weapons were recovered, and the search for more insurgents continues.

description: A chilling child murder spree has been uncovered in Haryana, with a 34-year-old woman, Poonam, confessing to drowning at least four children, including her own toddler son. Driven by an urge to kill children more attractive than her own, she meticulously staged the deaths as accidents. The latest victim was a six-year-old girl at a wedding.

The leaders will also tackle significant global concerns, particularly India's call for resolving the Russia-Ukraine crisis through diplomatic channels.

Despite centuries from Kohli and Gaikwad, Markram's 110 led the visitors to a memorable victory, leveling the series.

title: On divorce, Muslim man must return bride parents’ gifts: SC
description: The Supreme Court has made a pivotal ruling that requires bridegrooms to return any financial gifts received from their father-in-law upon divorce, directing that these gifts should revert to the bride. This decision, rooted in addressing patriarchal biases, references the Muslim Women's Act of 1986, designed to safeguard women's dignity and economic stability post-divorce.

title: Sanchar Saathi row: After outcry, govt drops order to pre-install its app on mobiles
description: The government has withdrawn its directive mandating the pre-installation of the Sanchar Saathi app on new smartphones following widespread criticism from the industry and opposition. While defending the app's utility for cyber security, officials admitted being surprised by the strong negative reaction from global manufacturers. The decision aims to de-escalate the controversy.

description: Justice Nagarathna said there are so many languages in the 8th Schedule of the Constitution, and in South India, there are at least six languages.

India takes over IIDEA chairship; CEC vows to share 75 years of poll expertise
description: India, through Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar, has accepted the chairship of the International Institute for Democracy and Electoral Assistance (IIDEA). Kumar pledged to share India's extensive experience in transparent elections to foster more inclusive and resilient democracies globally. This significant role highlights the Election Commission of India's international credibility and innovative approach to electoral management.

title: Academics protest against Bill to revamp Indian Statistical Institute
description: The historic institute, founded by P.C. Mahalanobis, is considered the gold standard of statistical research in India; the Bill will significantly alter the functioning of the institute ‘severely stripping it of its academic autonomy’, the petitioners said in an appeal to the Union Ministry of Statistics and Implementation

description: MacKenzie Scott, Jeff Bezos' ex-wife, has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, donating billions to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. Her recent $80 million gift to Howard University highlights her focus on substantial contributions to DEI and disaster relief. Scott's philanthropic efforts continue to impact numerous causes, solidifying her position as a top global philanthropist.

Both leaders are awaiting a decision from Delhi, with potential solutions ranging from status quo to power rotation.

Lakers legend Elden Campbell dies at 57; what we know about his cause of death
description: Elden Campbell, a dependable big man for the Lakers in the '90s, has died at 57. The Los Angeles native played 8½ seasons with his hometown team, bridging eras before winning a championship with the Detroit Pistons in 2004. Known for his calm, fluid style, Campbell was a valued role player who earned respect throughout his 15-year NBA career.

description: Cardi B is embracing motherhood again, sharing tender moments with her newborn son and boyfriend Stefon Diggs on Instagram. The rapper also offered glimpses of her other children, Kulture, Wave, and Blossom, highlighting the joys and realities of family life. This new chapter signifies personal growth and a continued commitment to her artistic career.

title: Tech layoffs: IBM CEO says job cuts not due to AI; blames overhiring in Covid years
description: IBM CEO Arvind Krishna attributes current tech layoffs to pandemic-era over-hiring, not AI, calling it a "natural correction." While acknowledging AI will cause some job displacement, Krishna believes increased productivity will lead to new roles and overall hiring growth, particularly for college graduates.

title: Auston Matthews captaincy questioned as ex-Leafs GM says team picked wrong leader
description: Former executive Gord Stellick questions Auston Matthews' captaincy, suggesting leadership and talent are not synonymous. He believes the team lost its compass after the shift, with John Tavares' quiet professionalism now seen as a potential stabilizing force. The current leadership faces a critical test to steer the team back to resilience.
